Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: Mumbai - dreams aren’t made here, they are carved out. The speed at which this city moves leaves the world far behind. Only in Mumbai is every man the hero of his own journey, written in the gullies of the city. Every gully is an arena for victory and defeat, where each passing moment is an opportunity to make a move and where every move tells a new story.

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: And only in Mumbai do the largest of stories have the smallest of beginnings. Dreams aren’t just seen over here, they are gained with victory. And such stories begin in these very gullies, where a small step can sometimes change the fate of this world.

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: And within these gullies lies Raghu - a new player in the city, ripe with ambitions of wealth, power and reputation. A player like Raghu yearns for conflict in the gullies of Mumbai. For with every conflict comes a new opportunity.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Jimmy, where are you bhai? I’ve reached the station.

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Relax brother. I’m at the tea stall near the station. Come, some cutting chai is waiting for you.

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Raghu! Over here!

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Raghu! You look very confident today! What’s the scene, hero?

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Jimmy Bhai, you are the hero! But I want to be a hero too bhai!

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Leave it to your bhai to turn you into a hero, you just wait and see…But first let’s have some cutting chai!

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Action: Gives a bundle of tickets to Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Listen brother, here’s your move for the day. Something special - tickets in black. The movie’s housefull, and people will pay over the top for these. You won’t find any spicier work in the market today!

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: How’d you end up with these tickets? What trick did you pull off, Jimmy bhai?

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: My source is solid, Raghu! Sell these tickets near the theater. Find some hopeless romantics and tell them to buy the tickets in black! The people will be happy and so will we!

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Jimmy bhai, we could earn some good money with this! How much do you reckon?

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Sell the tickets at double the price! The more you sell, the more we’ll make! You have the brains and I have the goods, the rest we leave to the people. The money will fall right into our hands!

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Understood! And if I get caught?

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Those who take risks become heroes. Everyone else is an extra! If you don’t make a move, how else will you earn, and how else will you spend?

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Jimmy bhai, you just wait and watch! I’ll sell all of these tickets. If I fail to sell a single ticket, you might as well change my name. My blood is boiling, I can’t wait to begin!

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: That’s the spirit! Dreams are sold in the gullies of this city. And someone like you knows how to sell these dreams! Now, get to work!

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Get your tickets! Front row seats at 5 Rupees each. Some romance right before your eyes, for you and your girl! Hurry up, before they sell out!
Want some first class tickets? 5 Rupees each. Seats fit for kings!
Here, take some corner seats - a nice cool spot for some romance. 5 rupees each, a special discount since you’re with bhabhi!

Eng.Speaker: Police Constable
Eng.Dialogue: Hey! You are selling black tickets! Stop!

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: No time to wait. Time to fly. The tickets are sold out and the money is in my pocket…hahaha, Try and catch me!

Eng.Speaker: Police Constable
Eng.Dialogue: Oi Stop!
Stop running, asshole!
What are you doing? Stop!
I’m taking you to the police station, asshole.

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy (VO)
Eng.Dialogue: Are you still breathing? Heard you were being chased by the cops.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Jimmy Bhai, I can’t be caught easily. I’m the king of the streets, remember?

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy (VO)
Eng.Dialogue: Yes, you fly like a kite! Now pick up some desi liquor and meet me at our usual spot.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Understood, Jimmy Bhai! I’ll pick up a bottle of good old desi and then straight to our spot.

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: At night in this city, every person makes a move. For some it’s a meal twice a day, while for others it's a matter of life and death. Tonight Raghu is also out to make a move. Whether it falls in his favor or whether it leads to his ruin, only time will tell.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Mister, give me one of those bottles of desi liquor. Tonight I’m in the mood for some fun!

Eng.Speaker: Local Goon 1
Eng.Dialogue: Oi boss! Earning a lot, aren’t you? We’re here to collect protection money. If you don’t pay us, we will tear this whole place down, bastard!

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Oi hero! Speak to your elders with respect! He’s a senior citizen, understood?

Eng.Speaker: Local Goon 1
Eng.Dialogue: And who the fuck are you to tell us?

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: I’m your Daddy, I’m their Daddy, I’m this whole area’s DADDY! Let me show you now!

Eng.Speaker: Local Goon 1
Eng.Dialogue: We’ll put you in your place!
The bastard thinks too highly of himself!
We’ll tear your ass wide open!

Eng.Speaker: Local Goon 1
Eng.Dialogue: Thought you were special, eh? Motherfucker

Eng.Speaker: Local Goon 2
Eng.Dialogue: Thought you were special, eh? Motherfucker

Eng.Speaker: Local Goon 3
Eng.Dialogue: Thought you were special, eh? Motherfucker

Eng.Speaker: Crowd
Eng.Dialogue: Raghu Bhai Zindabad! Raghu Bhai Zindabad!

Eng.Speaker: Wineshop Owner
Eng.Dialogue: Now that’s a real man! Forget that desi liquor. Here’s a bottle of imported, as a token of gratitude.

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: This wasn’t just a show of strength from Raghu, this was also a display of his worth. But now the real games begin. The night is still young and Raghu has more moves to make.

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Oi Raghu! You’re still alive? Was getting worried about you. Now tell me what lies ahead.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Jimmy Bhai, there’s something going on in the side. But I can’t talk about it yet. It will take a while but everything will be sorted in time.

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Listen Raghu, when you keep your secrets to yourself, that’s what worries me. Take care of yourself! One wrong move and all will be lost.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Don’t take tension, Jimmy bhai. I have it in my grasp. It’s a small hassle but everything will be set. You just see!

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Yes, but remember that Raheem Bhai is hosting the carrom tournament tomorrow. Win the tournament and it’s one foot through the door. But first, take care of your neck, will you?

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Jimmy Bhai, I will win tomorrow’s tournament! It will be my path inside. Winning will only further increase my reputation. Then we will be set!

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Then get a good night’s sleep. You need to bring your A game, understood? And listen, here’s my pistol. It’s a 9mm, should things go sideways tomorrow.

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: The night’s about to end but for Raghu, the games have now begun. Tomorrow could lead to victory for him or could snatch everything from the palm of his hand. Which way will fate bless? Only tomorrow will tell.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: I’ve had too many drinks tonight. I should get some sleep.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: I should go to the carrom club. The tournament will begin soon.

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: The carrom board was now a battlefield for Raghu. Each shot was an attack, and every pocket brought him closer to his destiny. All the opponents tried in vain but Raghu was now on the brink of victory - the final awaited.

Eng.Speaker: Carrom Club Goon 1
Eng.Dialogue: Oi Raghu! Making some big moves, are you? We’ve come to put you in your place, bastard! Your game ends now!

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Action: taking a cigarette drag, cool as ice
Eng.Dialogue: Stop wasting my time, idiot. I deal with mosquitos like you for lunch. I can see you’ve brought a bunch of cowards with you. One more step and I’ll show you your worth!

Eng.Speaker: Carrom Club Goon 1
Eng.Dialogue: Kill the bastard!
We will tear you a new one!
You will die!
Killed the son of a bitch!

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: For Raghu, this was just a little skirmish. The real war was just about to begin. Goons were dealt with in due fashion but with what lay ahead, losing could be a matter of life and death.

Eng.Speaker: Pathan
Eng.Dialogue: Pathan here. Surely you’ve heard of me. Thought you could breeze your way to victory? You are going to throw the match at Raheem Bhai’s tournament, understood?

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: What? But I didn’t come here to lose.

Eng.Speaker: Pathan
Eng.Dialogue: If you want to stay alive, you will throw the match. You won’t decide the fate of this match, Pathan will.

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: Pathan’s men drove off with the winner but left behind a fire within Raghu. Defeat was just a means to an end and the game was now a matter of life and death.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: What’s the scene, Jimmy? Seems like a big move, given the hour.

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Yes bhai, it’s Sethiya’s mansion. His family is out of town so he’s got a few bodyguards protecting the mansion. There’s a lot of loot inside for us to quietly ransack.

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: First, you deal with the bodyguards. Then you clear all the loot from the locker. The rest has been set by me, understood?

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: You turned out to be a mastermind, eh Jimmy? Don’t worry bhai, I will be as quiet as a mouse.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: That was a close call! I should go meet Reshma at the Jalwa Bar. It's been a while since I’d last seen her.

Eng.Speaker: Ramvilas Tawde
Eng.Dialogue: How does an idiot like him get a girl like that?

Eng.Speaker: Reshma
Eng.Action: reacts to Raghu tossing cash and dancing with her
Eng.Dialogue: Where did you get this money from, Raghu? Did you win the lottery?

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Don’t stress over it, Reshma. Come with me, we’ll have some fun tonight.

Eng.Speaker: Ramvilas Tawde
Eng.Dialogue: Raghu! What bullshit is this? This bar is in my area, and you will behave yourself!

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Take a chill pill, Ramvilas Bhai! I’m in the mood for some fun.Don’t be a spoilsport.

Eng.Speaker: Ramvilas Tawde
Eng.Dialogue: Don’t you understand? This is my place and there is no room here for someone like you. Now get out of my bar!

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Ramvilas Bhai, you will remember this! It won’t be so easy to throw me out. Let’s see for ourselves, who removes who!

Eng.Speaker: Ramvilas Tawde
Eng.Action: signals his men to throw out Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: The bastard’s got a long tongue. Throw him out, Now!

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: Dance bars are usually reserved for revelry. But when egos collide, festivities can soon take a wrong turn. Just like how the night took one.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: I’m tired. I should go home and get some sleep.

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Raghu bhai, something urgent came up. I need you to steal some imported goods from the electronics store. Sending you the location. Better hurry!

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Did you pick up the goods? Are those police sirens I hear?

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Yes bhai, the score was successful. I’ll deal with the police, don’t worry about it.

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Did you escape from the police?

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Yes bhai, the cops have been left behind.

Eng.Speaker: Jimmy
Eng.Dialogue: Excellent! Now park the car in Tony’s garage. There’s a surprise waiting for you.

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: Amidst the chaos of the night, Raghu got the job done. The cops were after him but our man was always one step ahead. However, the night was yet to end and a new story was about to unfold.

Eng.Speaker: Ashok Deshpande
Eng.Action: talks to Raghu with a slow grin
Eng.Dialogue: So you’re Raghu, eh? Heard you were a smart one but I had to see for myself just how you play the game. This city’s every corner is within the palm of my hand, and you…are just a pawn on a large chessboard. Let’s see if you are worthy of more, or not.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Deshpande Bhai, I am built from another cloth. Tell me what to do and I’ll see to it that it gets done. See for yourself, how I set myself up for greater things.

Eng.Speaker: Ashok Deshpande
Eng.Dialogue: Oh really? Then listen. Head over to Flora Fountain at noon and meet my contact there. Collect the briefcase from him and deliver them to Blue Arch Bar. Any mistakes and the game will end for you there and then.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: The goods will be safe Deshpande Bhai. And the job will be done, you have my word. Don’t worry about it.

Eng.Speaker: Ashok Deshpande
Eng.Dialogue: Looking at your confidence, I can see that you’re eager to move on to grander things. But you have yet a lot to learn. Remember who you work for and everything will be fine. Now get to it.

Eng.Speaker: Ashok Deshpande
Eng.Dialogue: The work was done well but this was just a teaser as to what is to follow. You will get one more opportunity to impress me with a show of strength. Meet me at Nariman Point.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Deshpande Bhai, the higher the stakes, the more the fun. I’ll see you at Nariman Point.

Eng.Speaker: Ashok Deshpande
Eng.Dialogue: I have a big task for you, Raghu. The game needs to end for Ramvilas Tawde. Tomorrow afternoon he will be at his textile factory. End his story there.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Deshpande Bhai, once the work is in my hands, I’ll see to it that it’s done.

Eng.Speaker: Ashok Deshpande
Eng.Dialogue: Remember, Raghu. The factory is in Tawde’s area. If you lose, no one will remember you. Win and destiny will be in your favor.
And listen, you’ll need this. Go to Powale’s shop in Kalbadevi tomorrow morning. Such special circumstances call for special weapons. He’ll do the needful.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Thank you Deshpande Bhai. Consider the deed done.

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: In this city, decisions are made quickly. One wrong step and it’s your name in the dirt.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Ashok Deshpande has sent me.

Eng.Speaker: Powale (Arms Dealer)
Eng.Dialogue: You’ve come to the right place.

Eng.Speaker: Ramvilas Tawde
Eng.Dialogue: Raghu Bhai, I was mistaken. From now on you are my boss. Please give me a chance. Forgive me.

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: This city will now listen to only one boss, and that is me. Your time is up, Tawde. My hands are enough for you

Eng.Speaker: Ramvilas Tawde
Eng.Dialogue: Raghu bhai…it was a mistake. Just a mistake. Please listen…I will remain your dog for life. Please forgive me…just this one time!

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: Mistake? A dog like you makes mistakes with each passing moment, and today the time has come to settle your life’s accounts. You’ve sealed your own fate, now only one road is left to take - game over.

Eng.Speaker: Ramvilas Tawde
Eng.Dialogue: No! No bhai! Take whatever you want, but please give me one last chance. Leave me alive, just once! I will touch your feet, just leave me alive, bhai!

Eng.Speaker: Raghu
Eng.Dialogue: No point in leaving a snake like you alive. Your right to live ends now. The game ends for you today. Death is your punishment, and this is your fate.

Eng.Speaker: Narrator
Eng.Dialogue: In this world, there is only one reality - kill or be killed. Today Tawde wrote the last page of his life’s book, and Raghu..had now become the hero of this game. But this was just the beginning. This city was now in Raghu’s control, and what was to follow was now in the palm of his hands.
